title: FAQ/blog: pointers and values and control over memory
body:
answer to these kinds of questions:

Pointers vs. Values
I am not sure if I am happy with that pointer/value business. The
all-things-are-references semantics of Java are much simpler. The C++ reference vs.
value syntax is also quite nice. The disparity between the programmer and the language
(maps and slices are reference types with a special constructor) bothers me. Unify the
syntax for both kinds of values, please, and enable library programmers to offer the
same programming interface.
http://www.syntax-k.de/projekte/go-review
